Reviews.Title: “stealing!”
Reviews.Author: yulia5_07
Reviews.Content: Location is good but... We were robbed out of our money in your hotel. Money were pulled out of our closed suitcase in a locked room. The hotel, which can not ensure the safety of guests must not exist.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Teacherguerreiro
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right next to the National Library (well worth a visit), 5 minute walk to Puerta de Alcalá, Cibeles and Retiro, 10 minutes to El Prado. Flat very basic but also very clean and practical (don't expect any luxuries, but for the price we paid we were quite happy) and it's quite convenient to have access to a small kitchen when you'r travelling with young children, we could cook and keep food in the fridge. Breakfast didn't have much variety, but there was fresh out of the oven bread and croissants. Only problem: Breakfast room very small so if you'r not early you might have to wait for a table, but there's always plenty of food. A microwave in the kitchenette would have been useful.

Reviews.Title: “Apartamentos Recoletos : convenient for visiting central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Nazaire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apartamentos Recoletos as a mature couple for a week in April 2012. It was easy to find when arriving by car and not difficult to get in and out of Madrid, if touring other place like Segovia and Toledo, excepting peak periods. The day of our arrival was a public holiday and the person on the duty desk did not speak any English; nevertheless we received a very friendly and courteous welcome. The apartment was small but functional. It was very clean but smelt very strongly of cigarettes. The décor is fairly tired and scruffy in places but it was always well cleaned every day. The cleaning staff were friendly. The breakfast room was on the fourth floor accessible by the old fashioned and rather small lifts. Breakfast can be described as functional, the coffee was fine but the food was pretty poor compared to other places we have stayed. The breakfast area could hold about 30 persons and at times there was a huge queue outside. It helped to think in advance about when most people were likely to turn up in order to avoid a 30 minute wait. Internet access is available at € 6 per 24 hours; it was surprising to have to pay for that when these days most places offer it for free. Apartamentos Recoletos is situated in the district of Salamanca, a rather chic area with expensive clothes and jewellery shops and consulates, but almost devoid of shops where you could buy food basics such as bread or milk. The only place we found was a shop/self service restaurant called VIP across the main road (Paseo de Recoletos) in the Calle de Génova, opposite the Colon metro station. The VIP self service restaurant was good for a simple low cost meal (about € 10 for the Menu del Dia). Car parking outside the Apartamentos Recoletos was frankly horrendous. We arrived at the end of the afternoon and thanks to the Easter holiday period, we were able to leave the car outside on the Calle de Villanueva the whole weekend at no cost. The problem was when everybody started back to work on Monday. If you are lucky enough find a place then its € 1 or 2 for an hour starting at 08h00 until 20h00; you can only park in the same place once. There were lots of traffic wardens out at 08h00 ! The alternatives are underground parking; there are several nearby. These will cost you € 30 per day in cash, no credit cards accepted. We had no choice but to pay out € 60 for two days. I appreciate I've laboured this point a bit, but bear in mind that a 5 day stay could cost you € 150 in parking unless you want to get up every day at 07h30 and spend your vacation looking for a parking place ! Next time we visit Madrid we'll pay more attention to that. Apart from my moan about parking, I have to say that it was a very convenient place to stay for visiting central Madrid. It was easy to walk to Calle Gran Via and Sol in 10-15 minutes, the same time it takes to walk to the museums (Prado and Thyssen) with the Reina Sofia another 5 minutes. The Retiro Park is equally close. To travel further afield you can use the Metro from the Colon stop across the Paseo de Recoletos. Overall we were satisfied with our stay but bear in mind the supplementary costs like parking that can be a disagreeable surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and old but well located”
Reviews.Author: Santiago P P
Reviews.Content: This is not a very nice place to stay. In other words, if you are going for a romantic weekend in Madrid with your significant other, don't choose this hotel for your stay. It's old, depressing, not as clean as you would hope, in a clear state of deterioration. Our dor, for instance, woulnd't close properly, and we had to call maintenance for it to be checked. However, if you are in Madrid alone for business and for a short time (for example, if you have to work at the Spanish National Library), then this could be convenient for you, because it is cheap and very well located, a few meters away from Plaza Colón and Paseo de Recoletos.

Reviews.Title: “It was hard to communicate in english”
Reviews.Author: Szuk
Reviews.Content: My overal rating of this hotel is poor. The room was very dark, additionally after 2 days half of the lights went off and it was impossible to turn them on. No one wanted to fix it, sayng that the maintance person was on holiday... During my stay at this "hotel" I had to learn spanish, because the staff knwe only a couple of words in english. The hotel is in a very bad condition, almost everything is broken or works as if it would be soon. Despite having 4 elevators only 1 was working, I had to pull the door very hard to open it. The room had a small kitchen which was suposed to be equipped but was not. The kitchen had no ventilation and was dirty. The cleaning ladies did not clean the kitchen a single time during my nearly one month stay. The room had only one working power outlet. The AC control panel was analog and in spanish, but it was not cooling but throwing stinking air into the room. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. The only good think is the location of this "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “No great shakes”
Reviews.Author: PetitRaton
Reviews.Content: First, the place looks much better on the website than in real life. It's too big to be cozy and it's kind of shabby, it has definitely seen better days. Fortunately, they have reconstructed the bathrooms since its heyday, so they're all right. The rooms are spacious. We had one of the interior rooms, so the view was not much, but it was quiet. The breakfast is typically Spanish, that means lots of pastry or toast with jam. If you are used to have cheese or ham, forget it. On the other hand, you can bring your own cheese, or yogurt or whatever you fancy to the breakfast room. You enjoy your stay more if you know at least some Spanish: the receptionists usually reply in Spanish to your question asked in English. The beds are made every day, but we'd appreciate if the cleaning staff mopped the floor once a week and vacuumed behind the sofa and under the beds at least a few times a year if this cannot be done weekly.

Reviews.Title: “a little overpriced, but you save in other ways”
Reviews.Author: lollipopDublin
Reviews.Content: 9 times out of 10 there were no English speakers available at the reception area. I'm not one of those arrogant tourists who expects that all hotels in foreign countries should have English speakers. It's just that the hotel claimed that this was so and it wasn't. Anyway I enjoyed my stay here since I speak Spanish. I love the fact that there was a kitchenette because we saved a fortune cooking for ourselves. Also, we didn't bring check-in luggage. We just had cabin luggage with a few changes of clothes, as there is a washing machine and dryer available. Saved us a fortune on the flight. TV channels not great, but you can keep nice and cool with the air conditioning. I'll go back I think.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: orangecorner
Reviews.Content: The best thing is that it is just in the center of Madrid and in a shirt walk of everything. The cleaning is good and I haven´t problems with the keating. The street is very quiet and you won´t have problems to sleep. Problems: It needs urgently new beds, I wake up every day with backache.

Reviews.Title: “Not very modern/comfy, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jodelahanneke
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this aparthotel with two small kids. Our spanish friend booked this for us and paid for it which in itself was fantastic of course. The hotel is self catering (if you please) so no restaurant or breakfast. The appartment was fine... though it was dark because of bad view and quite dirty windows, there was a seperate bedroom for us parents, the beds weer okay. Unfortunately you had to go up a few steps to get into theis room, which made it very scary with the toddlers around (one of them actually fell off them...) There was a small kitchen with a fridge (great in Hot Madrid). The photo's on the original website of this hotel makes it look a lot better than the actual looks... Apositive thing is that it is very centrally located and the neighbourhood was fine. A lot of young people stayed here which made it sometimes a bit noisy, but for our trip: just 4 nights it was fine even with the kids.
